concept.title: DITA authoring concepts
concept.shortdesc: Moving from style-based authoring to a structured authoring methodology such as DITA requires a radically different approach to writing.

conbody.lq: DITA is an open content standard that defines a common structure for content that promotes the consistent creation, sharing, and re-use of content.

p.draft-comment: This section needs reorganisation, and more DITA overview content from papers, WinANT, or HATC424. (Perhaps refer to TACTICS workbook?) Some of the topics should be moved to the Literature review section of the Exegesis.

Need to add an introduction topic to say that this Manual of Style isn't a replacement for the DITA Langref, but is intended to be read alongside it. Also, it is not intended to be a comprehensive guide to all DITA elements and attributes, and nor is it intended to be a DITA training manual. It is intended to be a reference when contentious issues are encountered. It documents a series of suggestions for how DITA should be implemented, and its main goal is to provide a tool for creating consistent and logical DITA semantic mark-up.
